It is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of tiny, hair-like structures. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds and are protected by a unique, kidney-shaped indusium. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Trichomanes luerssenii is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
